translated: are such that

original: nged kyis smra ci dgos /
analyzed: nged kyis smra ci dgos /
translated: what need is there for me to speak?”

original: de nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi dang 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te dbyar khang du song ngo //
analyzed: de nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi dang 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te dbyar khang du song ngo //
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī and her retinue of five hundred bhikṣuṇīs bowed their heads to the feet of the most senior bhikṣus and returned to the rainy-season retreat.

original: de 'khor gsum po dag gi rnam pa la brtags @173a *//
analyzed: de 'khor gsum po dag gi rnam pa la brtags @173a *//
translated: She examined the three spheres

original: nas nyin zhag bdun du gang thos nas sems can mang pos khyad par chen po thob par lta bu'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: nas nyin zhag bdun du gang thos nas sems can mang pos khyad par chen po thob par lta bu'i chos bstan to //
translated: and for seven days taught the Dharma in such a way that many beings attained great distinction.

original: de nas sa phyogs bar skabs yangs pa zhig tu dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gung la skyil mo krung phyed bcas nas 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas sa phyogs bar skabs yangs pa zhig tu dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gung la skyil mo krung phyed bcas nas 'dug go /
translated: Then, in a spacious area, she sat cross-legged in front of the bhikṣuṇīs.

original: dge slong ma de dag kyang de bzhin du 'dug go /🔽de nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te gang la sems mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: dge slong ma de dag kyang de bzhin du 'dug go / de nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te gang la sems mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: The bhikṣuṇīs also sat in the same way.🔽Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī entered this kind of samādhi.

original: rang gi stan las mi snang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: rang gi stan las mi snang bar gyur cing /
translated: When she settled her mind in this way, she disappeared from her seat.

original: shar phyogs kyi steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi po 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag ston par byed cing /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi po 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag ston par byed cing /
translated: She rose up into the sky above the east and demonstrated the four modes of conduct: walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: me'i khams la yang snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: me'i khams la yang snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: She also entered the fire element samādhi.

original: me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i lus las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i lus las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: After entering the fire element samādhi, various kinds of light emanated from Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī’s body.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / btsod ka dang / shel gyi mdog lta bu dag stan par byed cing /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / btsod ka dang / shel gyi mdog lta bu dag stan par byed cing /
translated: yellow, red, white, purple, and crystal-colored.

original: cho 'phrul zung dag kyang ston par byed de /
analyzed: cho 'phrul zung dag kyang ston par byed de /
translated: He also displayed the double miracle,

original: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar la lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung ba dang / lus kyi stod nas me 'bar la /
analyzed: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar la lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung ba dang / lus kyi stod nas me 'bar la /
translated: fire blazing from the lower part of his body and a stream of cold water flowing from the upper part of his body,

original: lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung bar byed do //
translated: and fire blazing from the upper part of his body and a stream of cold water flowing from the lower part of his body.

original: shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as in the east,

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs su yang de bzhin byed de /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs su yang de bzhin byed de /
translated: so also in the south, west, and north.

original: 'di ltar @173b phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi po dag ston par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar @173b phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi po dag ston par byed cing /
translated: Thus, he displayed the four kinds of miraculous abilities in the four directions,

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: and then he entered the first meditative concentration.

original: dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: The five hundred nuns also entered the first meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po las langs nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las langs nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la /
translated: Then, having risen from the first concentration, he entered the second concentration.

original: gnyis pa las gsum pa la /
analyzed: gnyis pa las gsum pa la /
translated: From the second concentration, he entered the third concentration.

original: gsum pa las bsam gtan bzhi pa la /
analyzed: gsum pa las bsam gtan bzhi pa la /
translated: From the third concentration, he entered the fourth concentration.

original: bzhi pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la /
analyzed: bzhi pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la /
translated: From the fourth concentration, he entered the sphere of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la /
translated: From the sphere of infinite space, he entered the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las ci yang med pa'i skye mched la /🔽ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las ci yang med pa'i skye mched la / ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: From the sphere of infinite consciousness, he entered the sphere of nothingness.🔽From the sphere of nothingness, he entered the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las langs nas yang ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las langs nas yang ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Having risen from the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, he again entered the sphere of nothingness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la /
translated: From the sphere of nothingness, he entered the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la /
translated: From the sphere of infinite consciousness, he entered the sphere of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las bsam gtan bzhi pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las bsam gtan bzhi pa la /
translated: from the sphere of infinite space to the fourth concentration,

original: bzhi pa las gsum pa la /
analyzed: bzhi pa las gsum pa la /
translated: from the fourth to the third,

original: gsum pa las gnyis pa la /
analyzed: gsum pa las gnyis pa la /
translated: from the third to the second,

original: gnyis pa las bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa las bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: and from the second to the first concentration.

original: de nas bsam gtan dang po de nyid la brten nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //🔽dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag kyang de bzhin du lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs las ldog par snyoms @174a *//
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan dang po de nyid la brten nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so // dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag kyang de bzhin du lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs las ldog par snyoms @174a *//
translated: Then, based on that first concentration, he attained complete nirvana.

original: par zhugs nas bsam gtan dang po nyid la brten te yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: par zhugs nas bsam gtan dang po nyid la brten te yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: Those five hundred nuns also entered meditative absorption in the forward and reverse order in the same way, and based on the first concentration, attained complete nirvana.

original: skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi mya ngan las 'das ma thag tu sa chen po g-yos par gyur cing /
analyzed: skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi mya ngan las 'das ma thag tu sa chen po g-yos par gyur cing /
translated: Immediately after the great Gotami, the mother of the Buddha, attained nirvana, the great earth shook,

original: skar mda' ltung ba dang / phyogs dmar po dang / bar snang la lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag byung ngo //
analyzed: skar mda' ltung ba dang / phyogs dmar po dang / bar snang la lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag byung ngo //
translated: meteors fell, the directions were red, and the sound of divine music was heard in the sky.

original: de nas dge slong gang ri rab kyi bang rim dang / gzhan yang grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / dben pa'i gnas mal dag na bsam gtan byed pa de dag gis sa chen po g-yos par rig nas sa chen po 'di ci'i phyir g-yos zhes bsam pa la zhugs na /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gang ri rab kyi bang rim dang / gzhan yang grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / dben pa'i gnas mal dag na bsam gtan byed pa de dag gis sa chen po g-yos par rig nas sa chen po 'di ci'i phyir g-yos zhes bsam pa la zhugs na /
translated: Then the monks who were meditating on the terraces of Mount Meru, and elsewhere in towns, villages, countries, royal palaces, and solitary places, knowing that the great earth was shaking, wondered, “Why is the great earth shaking?”

original: ji tsam na skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor lnga brgya dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mthong nas de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: ji tsam na skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor lnga brgya dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mthong nas de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They saw that Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī had passed into parinirvāṇa together with her retinue of five hundred. They thought,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sru yongs su mya ngan las 'das na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sru yongs su mya ngan las 'das na /
translated: “Since the Buddha’s aunt has passed into parinirvāṇa,

original: de'i lus la mchod pa lhag par bya ba la brtson par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i lus la mchod pa lhag par bya ba la brtson par bya'i /
translated: we should strive to make special offerings to her body.🔽Let us go!”

original: 'dong ngo // snyam nas de dag shing dri zhim po dag khyer nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i dbyar khang du dong ngo //
analyzed: 'dong ngo // snyam nas de dag shing dri zhim po dag khyer nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i dbyar khang du dong ngo //
translated: They took fragrant wood and went to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī’s summer house.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang nyan thos chen po kun shes koondin+ya dang / 'od srung chen po dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / ma 'gag pa dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang / mo'u 'gal gyi bu la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dag dang thabs cig tu skye rgu'i bdag mo chen @174b mo goo'u ta mi'i dbyar khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang nyan thos chen po kun shes koondin+ya dang / 'od srung chen po dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / ma 'gag pa dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang / mo'u 'gal gyi bu la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dag dang thabs cig tu skye rgu'i bdag mo chen @174b mo goo'u ta mi'i dbyar khang du gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One went to the summer house of Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī together with a great assembly of monks, including the great hearers Ājñātakauṇḍinya, Mahākāśyapa, Bakkula, Mahānāman, Aniruddha, Śāriputra, and Maudgalyāyana.

original: de bzhin du yul ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal btsun mo'i 'khor dang / gzhan nu dang / blon po dang / grong mi dang / yul gyi mi rnams kyi 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba dang / khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal btsun mo'i 'khor dang / gzhan nu dang / blon po dang / grong mi dang / yul gyi mi rnams kyi 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba dang / khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba dang /
translated: Similarly, King Prasenajit of the country of Kośala, surrounded by his retinue of queens, sons, ministers, townspeople, and country people, and the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, surrounded by his retinue,

original: ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma sa ga dang / bla mkhyen drang srong byin dang / rnying ba dang / gzhan yang yul sna tshogs nas lhags pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag kyang skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i dbyar khang du song ngo //
analyzed: ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma sa ga dang / bla mkhyen drang srong byin dang / rnying ba dang / gzhan yang yul sna tshogs nas lhags pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag kyang skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i dbyar khang du song ngo //
translated: and the mother of Śarabhaṅga, and the sage Bhīma, and the old woman, and the crowd of people who had come from various countries, all went to the house of Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rin po che dang / gos sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i khyogs lnga brgya dang / dri dang / bdug spos dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rin po che dang / gos sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i khyogs lnga brgya dang / dri dang / bdug spos dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
translated: Then King Prasenajit offered five hundred palanquins adorned with various jewels and garments, and various perfumes, incense, flowers, garlands, parasols, victory banners, and flags,

original: rol mo'i sgra rnam pa sna tshogs dag phul lo //
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra rnam pa sna tshogs dag phul lo //
translated: and various musical sounds.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo dang / ma 'gag pa dang / kun dga' bo dang / sgra gcan zin gyis skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i khyogs bteg go /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo dang / ma 'gag pa dang / kun dga' bo dang / sgra gcan zin gyis skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi'i khyogs bteg go /
translated: Then the Venerable Nanda, Aniruddha, Ānanda, and Rāhula lifted up the palanquin of Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phyag g-yas pas bzung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phyag g-yas pas bzung ngo //
translated: The Blessed One also held it with his right hand.

original: dge slong lhag ma rnams kyis kyang dge slong ma lhag ma rnams kyi khyogs bteg go /
analyzed: dge slong lhag ma rnams kyis kyang dge slong ma lhag ma rnams kyi khyogs bteg go /
translated: The remaining monks carried the remaining nuns’ bier.

original: de nas mchod pa chen po byas te khyer nas sa phyogs bar skabs dben sar khyogs rnams bzhag go /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa chen po byas te khyer nas sa phyogs bar skabs dben sar khyogs rnams bzhag go /
translated: Then, after making great offerings, they carried [the bodies] to a secluded place and set down the biers.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi dang / dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag gi lus las bla gos phud nas dge slong rnams @175a *//🔽la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi dang / dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag gi lus las bla gos phud nas dge slong rnams @175a *// la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One removed his upper robe from the body of Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī and the five hundred nuns and said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi dang / dge slong ma lnga brgya po 'di dag lo brgya nyi shu lon yang lus la gnyer ma dang / skra dkar med cing bu mo lo bcu drug lon pa lta bu la ltos /
analyzed: skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi dang / dge slong ma lnga brgya po 'di dag lo brgya nyi shu lon yang lus la gnyer ma dang / skra dkar med cing bu mo lo bcu drug lon pa lta bu la ltos /
translated: look at Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī and these five hundred nuns. Even though they are one hundred and twenty years old, their bodies are free of wrinkles and gray hair, and they look like sixteen-year-old girls.

original: de nas yul ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal btsun mo'i tshogs dang / gzhon nu dang / blon po dang / grong mi dang / yul mi dang bcas pas dri sna tshogs kyi shing gi phung po spungs nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya po'i sku gdung dag bsregs so //
analyzed: de nas yul ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal btsun mo'i tshogs dang / gzhon nu dang / blon po dang / grong mi dang / yul mi dang bcas pas dri sna tshogs kyi shing gi phung po spungs nas skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya po'i sku gdung dag bsregs so //
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala, together with his harem, princes, ministers, townspeople, and country people, piled up a heap of fragrant wood and cremated the remains of Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī and the five hundred nuns.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mi rtag pa dang ldan pa'i chos dag bshad nas gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mi rtag pa dang ldan pa'i chos dag bshad nas gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One, having taught the Dharma that is endowed with impermanence, went to the monastery.

original: gshegs nas kyang dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: gshegs nas kyang dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: Having gone there, he sat down on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: bzhugs nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bzhugs nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having sat down, he said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,🔽since there are such disadvantages in saying ‘I am well’ when one is sneezed at, and others as well,

original: 'di ltar sbrid pa byung ba la sos zhes zer ba la nyes dmigs 'di lta bu dang / gzhan dag kyang yod pas de lta bas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbrid pa byung ba la sos zhes zer ba la nyes dmigs 'di lta bu dang / gzhan dag kyang yod pas de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

analyzed: dge slong gis sbrid pa byung ba la sos zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: “Monks, you should not say ‘sneeze’ to a monk who sneezes.

original: brjod na / 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod na / 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do, you become guilty of an offense.”

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks became doubtful, and asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the Vanquisher of Doubts,🔽“Reverend, what karma did the five hundred nuns, including Mahāprajāpatī,

original: btsun pa / skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag gis las ci zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa / skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag gis las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: create that

original: des 'di dag skyes nas @175b dgung lo brgya nyi shu lags kyang lus la gnyer ma dang / skra dkar ma mchis shing /
analyzed: des 'di dag skyes nas @175b dgung lo brgya nyi shu lags kyang lus la gnyer ma dang / skra dkar ma mchis shing /
translated: they did not have wrinkles or gray hair on their bodies even though they were two hundred years old,

original: bu mo dgung lo bcu drug lon pa lta bu lags /
analyzed: bu mo dgung lo bcu drug lon pa lta bu lags /
translated: but were like sixteen-year-old girls?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa /🔽rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba /
analyzed: skye rgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi la sogs pa dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa / rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba /
translated: the five hundred nuns, including Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, themselves accumulated the karma

original: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa /
analyzed: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa /
translated: that has come together with its conditions🔽and is now ripening upon them.

original: gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba dag byas shing bsags te /
